sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: This section of the dcm4chee reference documentation is the DICOM Conformance Statement for the archive component of the dcm4chee SW package. The statement is formatted according to DICOM Supplement 64: Revised Part 2 (Conformance), Public Comment March 16, 2001.
dcm4chee - Archive is an implementation of an IHE (=Integrating the Healthcare Enterprise) compliant Image Archive and Report Repository. This includes the capabilities

listitem.para:
to store and retrieve various kind of DICOM Objects as:
Images from multiple modalities,
Grayscale Presentation States [GSPS], which specifies the presentations of images as grayscaling, zoom, text and graphical annotations,
Key Objects [KO], which specifies a particular selection of images for a specified reason and with an attached note,
Structured Reports [SR].
to process HL7 notification messages from the Order Filler, about Procedure Scheduling, Procedure Updates and Patient Information Updates,
to process DICOM Modality Performed Procedure Step [MPPS] messages from modalities and forward them to the Order Filler.

sect1.para: dcm4chee - Archive is a server application. Its Web-based User Interface is intended for system configuration and monitoring by system adminstrators.

row.entry: Initiator or User of Service Provider of Service

sect2.title: Abbreviations and Acronyms
sect2.para: The following symbols and abbreviations are used in this document:

row.entry: American Standard Code for Information Interchange
Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

sect2.title: Functional Overview
sect2.para:
dcm4chee - Archive consists of a set of processes:
dcmsrv
DICOM Server responsible for the bulk DICOM communication with remote systems,
mppssnd
DICOM Client which forwards MPPS messages received by dcmsrv to the Order Filler.
hl7srv
HL7 Receiver, which processes HL7 messages for Procedure Scheduling , Procedure Update and Patient Update, received from the Order Filler.
jmxagent
Master process, which contains dcmsrv, mppssnd and hl7srv and provides a Web Service for configuration and monitoring of its child processes.
jboss+tomcat
J2EE compliant Open-Source Application Server, which mediates the communication of dcmsrv and hl7srv with the used Database system. It also provides a Web-based User Interface to monitor and manipulate the archive content.
This DICOM Conformance Statement only describes in detail the two processes (= Application Entities) dcmsrv and mppssnd, which deal with DICOM communication.

dcmsrv provides the DICOM Verification Service as SCU and as SCP:
Implementation Model - Verification SCU+SCP by dcmsrv
The system administrator may verify the association to any remote AE by invoking the correspondend command via the Administration Web page for dcmsrv, provided by the jmxagent master process.

dcmsrv provides DICOM Storage Service for Images from multiple Modalities, Grayscale Presentation States, Key Object Selection Documents and various SR Documents as SCP. It also provides the DICOM Storage Commitment Service as SCP:
Implementation Model - Storage & Storage Commitment SCP by
dcmsrv
When dcmsrv receives a Storage Request for a DICOM Object, it checks, if the object was already stored by the application recently. If this was not the case, the object is stored to a - local or remote - File System and the Database is updated. When dcmsrv receives a Storage Commitment Request, it queries the Database, if the objects, which are referenced in the Commitment Request, are reliable stored in the archive. Subsequently, a Storage Commitment Result message, reflecting the query result, will be transmitted back to the remote AE .

dcmsrv provides DICOM Query/Retrieve Services as
SCP to query and retrieve the archive content. Support of the Retrieve Service implies the support of DICOM Storage Services for stored DICOM Objects (i.e.: Images from multiple Modalities, Grayscale Presentation States, Key Object Selection Documents and various SR Documents) as SCU:
Implementation Model - Query/Retrieve SCP & Storage SCU by
dcmsrv
When dcmsrv receives a Query Request, it performs a correspondend query of the Database and returns the result to the remote AE. When dcmsrv receives a Retrieve Request, it queries the Database to get the number and location of matching DICOM Objects. The Objects are load from the File System and updated with current Patient Information from the Database, before they are transmitted to the Retrieve Destination AE using DICOM Storage Services.

dcmsrv provides DICOM Modality Worklist Management and Modality Performed Procedure Step Services as SCP:
Implementation Model - MWL & MPPS SCP by dcmsrv
When dcmsrv receives a Query Worklist Request, it performs a correspondend query of the Database and returns the result to the remote AE. When dcmsrv a Create MPPS or Update MPPS Request, it performs a correspondend update of the Database. The received MPPS message are also stored into a Spool Directory, which is regularly polled by mppssnd.

mppssnd provides Modality Performed Procedure Step Services as SCU:
Implementation Model - MPPS SCU by mppssnd
mppssnd polls regularly a Spool Directory for MPPS messages filed by dcmsrv. Detected messages are loaded and transmitted using the DICOM Modality Performed Procedure Step Service to the Remote AE(i.e.:Order Filler). If the Remote AE confirms a success operation, the spooled MPPS message is deleted from the spool directory. Otherwise, the transmission of the MPPS message will be retried with decreasing frequency.

sect2.title: Functional Definition of dcmsrv
sect2.para: dcmsrv implements the DICOM Storage Service Class and the Verification Service Class as SCU and as SCP. DICOM Storage Commitment Service, Query/Retrieve Services, Modality Worklist Management and Modality Performed Procedure Step are only supported as SCP. Typically, dcmsrv is started by the jmxagent master process, together with mppssnd and hl7srv server applications. jmxagent also provides a Web-Service to change configuration parameter, and control the server status via any Web-Browser. That includes the possibility to shutdown the master process jmxagent remotely, which implicitly terminates all child processes.

sect3.title: SOP Classes
sect3.para: dcmsrv provides Standard Conformance to the following DICOM V3.0 SOP Classes:

Digital Intra-oral X-Ray Image Storage - For Processing

Study Root Query/Retrieve Information Model - MOVE

sect3.title: General Association Behavior
sect3.para:
dcmsrv proposes the DICOM standard application context name:
DICOM Application Context
Application Context Name 1.2.840.10008.3.1.1.1

dcmsrv supplies following values for Implementation Class UID and version name:
DICOM Implementation Class and Version
Implementation Class UID 1.2.40.0.13.1.1.1
Implementation Version Name DCM4CHE<ddMMMyy>
with <ddMMMyy> specifing the build date (e.g.24MAR02).

sect4.title: Number of Associations
sect4.para:
dcmsrv initiates only one DICOM association for each retrieve request. Hence the maximal number of simultaneously associations initated by dcmsrv is limited by the maximal number of simultaneous connected remote AEs, which is defined by the value of the configuration parameter MaxClients. Default = 5.
Number of Associations
Maximum number of simultaneous associations
MaxClients

sect4.title: Asynchronous Nature
sect4.para:
Asynchronous mode of operation is not supported.
Asynchronous Nature
Maximum number of outstanding asynchronous transactions 1

sect2.title: Functional Definition of mppssnd
sect2.para: mppssnd implements the DICOM Modality Performed Procedure Step as SCU. Typically, mppssnd is started by the jmxagent master process, together with the dcmsrv and hl7srv server applications. jmxagent also provides a Web-Service to change configuration parameter, and control the server status via any Web-Browser. That includes the possibility to shutdown the master process jmxagent remotely, which implicitly terminates all child processes.

sect3.title: SOP Classes
sect3.para: MppsSnd provides Standard Conformance to the following DICOM V3.0 SOP Classes:

row.entry: Modality Performed Procedure Step SOP Class

sect3.title: General Association Behavior
sect3.para:
mppssnd proposes the DICOM standard application context name:
DICOM Application Context
Application Context Name 1.2.840.10008.3.1.1.1

mppssnd supplies following values for Implementation Class UID and version name:
DICOM Implementation Class and Version
Implementation Class UID 1.2.40.0.13.1.1.1
Implementation Version Name DCM4CHE<ddMMMyy>
with <ddMMMyy> specifing the build date (e.g.24MAR02).

sect4.title: Number of Associations
sect4.para:
mppssnd initate only one association simultaneously.
Number of Associations
Maximum number of simultaneous associations 1

sect4.title: Asynchronous Nature
sect4.para:
Asynchronous mode of operation is not supported.
Asynchronous Nature
Maximum number of outstanding asynchronous transactions 1

sect3.title: Association Acceptance Policy
sect3.para: mppssnd does not accept any DICOM Association.

sect2.title: Services supported as SCU
sect2.para: Description of SOP specific details are not yet written

sect2.title: Services supported as SCP
sect2.para: Description of SOP specific details are not yet written.

sect3.title: TCP/IP Stack
sect3.para: dcm4chee services inherit their TCP/IP stack from the installed Java Runtime Environment.

sect2.title: Physical Network Interface
sect2.para: dcm4che is indifferent to the physical medium over which TCP/IP executes; it inherits this from the Java Runtime Environment.

sect2.title: API
sect2.para: The application makes use of the Socket classes of Sun’s Java Development Kit 1.3.

sect2.title: AE Title/Presentation Address Mapping
sect2.para:
The assignment of AE Titles and TCP/IP Port to AE dcmsrv and AE mppssnd is defined in the configuration file jmxagent.mlets of the master process jmxagent. It is possible to assign several AE Titles to dcmsrv, which can be used to file receiving DICOM Objects to different storage locations (File Systems), depending from the used Called AE Title. At default, configuration file jmxagent.mlets specifies following assignments:
AE Title configuration table
Application Entity Role Default AE Title Default TCP/IP Port
dcmsrv Both ARCHIVE 2351
dcmsrv Both RPT_REPOSITORY 2351
dcmsrv SCP MPPS_MGR 2351
mppssnd SCU MPPS_MGR NA

Additionally, AE Title, Host Name or IP Address and TCP/IP Port of Remote AEs must be configured, to enable dcmsrv to initiate a DICOM association to this AEs. That can be done via the Add DicomAET function on the Configuration Web Page for dcmsrv, provided by the master process jmxagent. The input must be formated according the schema: dicom://AET@host:port.

sect2.title: Parameters
sect2.para:
The main configuration file jmxagent.mlets of the master process jmxagent specifies initial values of the most important configuration parameters for dcmsrv and mppssnd. Further parameters can be displayed and modified via the Configuration Web Pages provided by jmxagent at http://localhost:8888.
Parameter Configurable in jmxagent.mlets Configurable via Web Page Default Value
dcmsrv Specific Parameters
Time-out waiting for acceptance or rejection Response to an Association Open Request. No Yes No Time-out
Maximum PDU size the AE can receive
No Yes 16352
Maximum PDU size the AE can send No No 65536
Number of simultaneous Associations by Service and/or SOP Class No Yes 5
Listening Port Yes Yes 2351
Accepted Called AETs Yes Yes ARCHIVE, RPT_REPOSITORY, MPPS_MGR
Accepted Calling AETs No Yes Any
Storage Directory Path Prefix Yes Yes \var\dcm4che\archive
Create and Update DICOMDIR in Storage Directories Yes Yes On
Spooling of received MPPS messages Yes Yes On
MPPS Spool Directory Yes Yes \var\dcm4che\spool
Generation of JPEG icons for received images Yes Yes On
Icon Storage Directory Path Prefix Yes Yes \var\dcm4che\icon
Max. Icon Height No Yes 128
Max. Icon Widtht No Yes 128
Retrieve DICOM Objects as received (=Deactivates update of Patient Information from database) No Yes Off
DICOM over TLS Yes Yes Off
Require Client Authentification Yes Yes -
Accepted TLS Ciphers Yes Yes -
mppsnd Specific Parameters
Maximum PDU size the AE can receive
No Yes 16352
Maximum PDU size the AE can send No No 65536
MPPS SCP Host Yes Yes localhost
MPPS SCP Port Yes Yes 2250
Used Called AET Yes Yes MESA_FILLER
Used Calling AET Yes Yes MPPS_MGR
MPPS Spool Directory Yes Yes \var\dcm4che\spool
Poll Intervall No Yes 10 s
Connection Retry Intervall No Yes 100 s

sect1.title: Support for Extended Character Sets
sect1.para: This application supports only ISO_IR 100 (ISO 8859-1 Latin 1) as extended character set.

sect2.title: Security Profiles
sect2.para: The dcmsrv AE supports secure DICOM communication in conformance with the Basic TLS Secure Transport Connection Profile. At default configuration, the TLS option is deactivated.

sect2.title: Association level security
sect2.para:
The dcmsrv AE can be configured to check Calling and Called AE Title in received Association initiation Request against configurable lists of accepted Calling and Called AE Titles. At default configuration, only the Called
AE Title will be verified.

sect2.title: Application level security
sect2.para: The jmxagent master process can be configured, to require login for web access to the configuration pages of its child processes.
